bug.description:
The <denchmark-link:http://docs.opencv.org/3.1.0/d6/d6e/group__imgproc__draw.html#ga482fa7b0f578fcdd8a174904592a6250>cv::drawMarker</denchmark-link> function draws the wrong shape for the <denchmark-link:http://docs.opencv.org/3.1.0/d6/d6e/group__imgproc__draw.html#ga0ad87faebef1039ec957737ecc633b7b>cv::MARKER_TRIANGLE_UP</denchmark-link> marker. Here is an example using OpenCV 3.1.0 Python bindings (of course the same happens from C++): import numpy as np import cv2
markers = [ cv2.MARKER_CROSS, cv2.MARKER_TILTED_CROSS, cv2.MARKER_STAR, cv2.MARKER_DIAMOND, cv2.MARKER_SQUARE, cv2.MARKER_TRIANGLE_UP, cv2.MARKER_TRIANGLE_DOWN ]
img = np.zeros((100,400,3), dtype=np.uint8) x = 50 for mt in markers: img = cv2.drawMarker(img, (x,50), (0,0,255), markerType=mt, markerSize=30, thickness=2, line_type=cv2.LINE_AA) x += 50
cv2.imshow('Draw Marker', img) cv2.waitKey(0) cv2.destroyAllWindows() <denchmark-link:https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/83908/12069015/87bd3236-b024-11e5-9b04-594cc08ecb54.png></denchmark-link>
(notice the next-to-last shape, which should be a triangle pointing upward â–³).

comments.comment: Thanks for reporting! A typo on my side it seems!
